documents.document: Can listening to Bonnie Tyler improve your quality of life? After doing it every day for a week, I’m here to tell you, it can. #Science

Attended the volunteer info night at @HospiceTO & @JHHospice. Wonderful end of life care organizations - highly in need of complementary therapy volunteers (music, expressive arts, massage). Get in touch w/ them if you have that magic touch or spread the word! #eol #dying

@theyoungjoo calls for deprogramming of ways of being for men from harmful, patriarchal power systems, reimagining what it means to be a man, embracing pro feminist approaches. We can’t shy away or ignore these things. But change is possible. It starts with each of us. #Dec6 https://t.co/DxdVP5Ir7T
RT @DocTrott: "Misogyny will not be conquered by downplaying or ignoring how gender and violence intersect. The sooner we accept that, the…

He links extreme acts of violence to everyday acts, dismissals and entitlements that continue in our lives. Expecting women to smile, be “nice”, give us attention, provide care. Sometimes women smile, are nice out of sheer safety concerns. A right to reject can get us murdered.

Listening to @theyoungjoo speak @WCHospital on toxic masculinity (socially constructed ideas of masculinity, entitlement, objectification, debasement of women), “senseless shootings” - which aren’t senseless to the murderers. #Dec6 https://t.co/tzVJY9mKsh

Mayor @JohnTory speaking on the issue of gender based violence at @WCHospital, honouring those murdered on #Dec6 1989, and tying it to continued acts like #Toronto’s van attack, the rise of toxic online culture that fuels this epidemic. https://t.co/svj4cWnp7B
@JasminMozaffari YES.
RT @rachelmack: I suppose I could post a list of names of the women murdered on this date in 1989, or I could talk about how a misogynist t…

Honour those we have lost. Donate to anti-violence organizations. Learn about gender-based violence, how it intersects w/ race, ability, age, sexual orientation. Learn abt resources to help others. Seek help if you need it thru friends, family, workplace programs, @AWHL #Dec6

Remember those often ignored because of racism, systemic violence, transphobia: Cindy Gladue, Tina Fontaine, Brenda Wolfe, Sandra Bland, Lamia Beard. Older women murdered by partners, Barbara Kovic, and those victims of cultural patriarchal violence, Aqsa Parvez. #Dec6

Relates his story how as a student there was a patient being sterilized w/out consent. Became debate in a paternalistic system, a racist act. He talks abt courage it takes to speak up to challenge power. The story ends w/ woman not being sterilized, bc of fearless speech.

He leaves us with a homework assignment on the topic of fearless speech. Parrhesia, as related by Michel Foucault. @akumagai1 says in developing the future of healthcare, we need to think about who and what we want to create - humanism, justice, excellence. https://t.co/jxxp9dXSuR

One reason I love my job at @wchf. Getting to listen in on thought leaders like @akumagai1 at @WCHospital. Today’s grand round on Professionalism. Only he can incorporate art history, philosophy, MeToo, Audre Lorde, Selma, Reconciliation, and Hannibal Lector in one presentation. https://t.co/87H8SucaXF

I panicked this a.m. looking @ my fingers, remembered I used tumeric for my cold-related sore gums y’day. My fingers resemble my ol’ Uncle Kenny’s smoker’s hands. Then I thought abt him, that he had a hard youth, was in prison, then became a geologist, taught me the clarinet. ❤️

It just occurred to me that if I had done this my whole life I might have extended my neck to the point where I could be as tall as the rest of my family of 6 foot plussers. Including my nephews. Alas, I shall remain the armrest in family photos.
